verses.text: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah , and came and said before Jonathan , What have I done ? what \add is\add* mine iniquity ? and what \add is\add* my sin before thy father , that he seeketh my life ?

And he said unto him, God forbid ; thou shalt not die : behold, my father will do nothing either great or small , but that he will shew it me: and why should my father hide this thing from me? it \add is\add* not \add so\add*.\f + \fr 20.2 \ft shew…: Heb. uncover mine ear\f*

And David sware moreover, and said , Thy father certainly knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes ; and he saith , Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved : but truly \add as\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth , and \add as\add* thy soul liveth , \add there is\add* but a step between me and death.

Then said Jonathan unto David , Whatsoever thy soul desireth , I will even do \add it\add* for thee.\f + \fr 20.4 \ft Whatsoever…: or, Say what is thy mind and I will do, etc\f*\f + \fr 20.4 \ft desireth: Heb. speaketh, or, thinketh\f*

And David said unto Jonathan , Behold, to morrow \add is\add* the new moon , and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat : but let me go , that I may hide myself in the field unto the third \add day\add* at even.

If thy father at all miss me, then say , David earnestly asked \add leave\add* of me that he might run to Beth-lehem his city : for \add there is\add* a yearly sacrifice there for all the family.\f + \fr 20.6 \ft sacrifice: or, feast\f*
If he say thus, \add It is\add* well ; thy servant shall have peace : but if he be very wroth , \add then\add* be sure that evil is determined by him.

Therefore thou shalt deal kindly with thy servant ; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with thee: notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity , slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father ? \p
And Jonathan said , Far be it from thee : for if I knew certainly that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?
Then said David to Jonathan , Who shall tell me? or what \add if\add* thy father answer thee roughly ? \p
¶ And Jonathan said unto David , Come , and let us go out into the field. And they went out both of them into the field.

And Jonathan said unto David , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , when I have sounded my father about to morrow any time , \add or\add* the third \add day\add*, and, behold, \add if there be\add* good toward David , and I then send not unto thee, and shew it thee;\f + \fr 20.12 \ft sounded: Heb. searched\f*\f + \fr 20.12 \ft shew…: Heb. uncover thine ear\f*

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* do so and much more to Jonathan : but if it please my father \add to do\add* thee evil , then I will shew it thee, and send thee away , that thou mayest go in peace : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* be with thee, as he hath been with my father.  +  r 20.13  t shew…: Heb. uncover thine ear *
And thou shalt not only while yet I live shew me the kindness of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that I die not:

But \add also\add* thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever : no, not when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.

So Jonathan made \add a covenant\add* with the house of David , \add saying\add*, Let the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* even require \add it\add* at the hand of David’s enemies.\f + \fr 20.16 \ft made: Heb. cut\f*
And Jonathan caused David to swear again , because he loved him: for he loved him as he loved his own soul.\f + \fr 20.17 \ft because…: or, by his love toward him\f*
Then Jonathan said to David , To morrow \add is\add* the new moon : and thou shalt be missed , because thy seat will be empty.\f + \fr 20.18 \ft empty: Heb. missed\f*

And \add when\add* thou hast stayed three days , \add then\add* thou shalt go down quickly , and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the business was \add in hand\add*, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.\f + \fr 20.19 \ft quickly: or, diligently: Heb. greatly\f*\f + \fr 20.19 \ft when the…: Heb. in the day of the business\f*\f + \fr 20.19 \ft Ezel: or, that sheweth the way\f*
And I will shoot three arrows on the side \add thereof\add*, as though I shot at a mark.

And, behold, I will send a lad , \add saying\add*, Go , find out the arrows. If I expressly say unto the lad , Behold, the arrows \add are\add* on this side of thee, take them; then come thou: for \add there is\add* peace to thee, and no hurt ; \add as\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth.\f + \fr 20.21 \ft no hurt: Heb. not any thing\f*
But if I say thus unto the young man , Behold, the arrows \add are\add* beyond thee; go thy way : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath sent thee away.
And \add as touching\add* the matter which thou and I have spoken of, behold, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add be\add* between thee and me for ever. \p
¶ So David hid himself in the field : and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to eat meat.
And the king sat upon his seat , as at other times , \add even\add* upon a seat by the wall : and Jonathan arose , and Abner sat by Saul’s side , and David’s place was empty.
Nevertheless Saul spake not any thing that day : for he thought , Something hath befallen him, he \add is\add* not clean ; surely he \add is\add* not clean.

And it came to pass on the morrow , \add which was\add* the second \add day\add* of the month , that David’s place was empty : and Saul said unto Jonathan his son , Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to meat , neither yesterday , nor to day ?
And Jonathan answered Saul , David earnestly asked \add leave\add* of me \add to go\add* to Beth-lehem :

And he said , Let me go , I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city ; and my brother , he hath commanded me \add to be there:\add* and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes , let me get away , I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he cometh not unto the king’s table.

Then Saul’s anger was kindled against Jonathan , and he said unto him, Thou son of the perverse rebellious \add woman\add*, do not I know that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thine own confusion , and unto the confusion of thy mother’s nakedness ?\f + \fr 20.30 \ft Thou…: or, Thou perverse rebel: Heb. Son of perverse rebellion\f*

For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the ground , thou shalt not be established , nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely die.\f + \fr 20.31 \ft shall…: Heb. is the son of death\f*
And Jonathan answered Saul his father , and said unto him, Wherefore shall he be slain ? what hath he done ?
And Saul cast a javelin at him to smite him: whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to slay David.
So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger , and did eat no meat the second day of the month : for he was grieved for David , because his father had done him shame. \p
¶ And it came to pass in the morning , that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David , and a little lad with him.
And he said unto his lad , Run , find out now the arrows which I shoot. \add And\add* as the lad ran , he shot an arrow beyond him.\f + \fr 20.36 \ft beyond…: Heb. to pass over him\f*
And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot , Jonathan cried after the lad , and said , \add Is\add* not the arrow beyond thee?
And Jonathan cried after the lad , Make speed , haste , stay not. And Jonathan’s lad gathered up the arrows , and came to his master.
But the lad knew not any thing : only Jonathan and David knew the matter.

And Jonathan gave his artillery unto his lad , and said unto him, Go , carry \add them\add* to the city.\f + \fr 20.40 \ft artillery: Heb. instruments\f*\f + \fr 20.40 \ft his lad: Heb. the lad that was his\f* \p

¶ \add And\add* as soon as the lad was gone , David arose out of \add a place\add* toward the south , and fell on his face to the ground , and bowed himself three times : and they kissed one another , and wept one with another , until David exceeded.

And Jonathan said to David , Go in peace , forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed for ever. And he arose and departed : and Jonathan went into the city.  +  r 20.42  t forasmuch…: or, the \+nd LORD\+nd* be witness of that which etc *
